question: You have seen an advertisement for a community college that needs teachers for night classes.Write a letter to the community college. In your letter:say which advertisement you are answeringdescribe which course(s) you want to teach, and what it/they would be aboutexplain why you would be a suitable teacher
text: Recently in the Montreal Today newspaper, I saw, that you are looking for a teacher who would be able to host classes for the community. I am interested in this.

Basically my main line of work is software development. I have a lot of experience in numerous technologies and I am eager to share my knowledge with your students. My course will be all about coding, the architecturing of applications and other IT stuff. The courses will not be long, I am planning to make a couple of sessions on each topic.

Unfortunately, I do not have any teaching experience. On the flip side, I have prepared a lot of interns and I am proud of what the newcomers achieved. Also, I am delighted to contribute to the community and make our society are better one.
Please let me know if I suit this position and if you are willing to give me a chance to help you.

error_list.error_des: It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase Basically. Consider adding a comma.
If you do not want architecturing to be marked as misspelled in the future, you can add it to your personal dictionary.
